updates.title: How to test for Deno 2 compatibility#
updates.description: A couple of months ago, we started migrating our Edge Functions platform to use Deno 2.1. Deno 2 bridges the gap between Node and Deno by supporting Node's built-in APIs, npm modules, and package.json. This would make it easy to migrate existing Node apps to run in the Edge Functions platform.

updates.title: Manage your Edge Functions directly from the dashboard#
updates.description: What better way to wrap up Launch Week 14 than a summary of what was shipped to the dashboard (as well as several other goodies that we also shipped behind the scenes üòâ)

updates.title: Why Dedicated Poolers#
updates.description: Today we‚Äôre announcing the official release of Dedicated Pooler - a PgBouncer instance co-located with your Postgres database for lower latency, better performance, and higher reliability.

updates.title: Why are we making these restrictions?#
updates.description: On April 21, we are restricting certain SQL actions you can perform in your database‚Äôs auth, storage, and realtime schemas.

updates.title: How to try#
updates.description: You can now try Deno 2.1 locally with Supabase CLI. The goal of local preview is to identify any regressions or missing functionality before we upgrade hosted version to Deno 2.1.

updates.title: Deploy an Edge Function#
updates.description: We have introduced two new API endpoints that allow you to deploy and update Edge Functions programmatically. This will be handy if you're building a Supabase integration or want to create an internal workflow without relying on Supabase CLI.

updates.title: Quick Example#
updates.description: TypeScript users, here's a cool new feature! Starting from v2.48.0, defining custom types for JSON fields in supabase-js and using them with the JSON selector is now easier, making your code more type-safe and intuitive.

updates.title: Dashboard Integrations#
updates.description: Launch Week 13 has wrapped up and it's now the holiday season! üéÑüéÅ If you might have missed our launches last week - fret not! We've got you covered with a brief summary of the changes that landed in the dashboard right here üôÇ

updates.title: Table Editor Performance Improvements#
updates.description: We've set aside some time to look into improving the performance of the Table Editor over the past few weeks, in particular shortening both perceived and actual loading times as you navigate around the Table Editor. This all comes together in several PRs as we explored from 2 angles:

updates.title: Notable issues resolved:#
updates.description: üöÄ Announcement: We‚Äôve just released supabase-js version 2.46.2-rc.3, which resolves several type errors in the PostgREST client.

updates.title: How to use deno.json#
updates.description: Each Edge Function can now have its own deno.json or deno.jsonc file to manage dependencies. You will need to deploy your functions using Supabase CLI version v1.215.0 or above to make use of this feature.

updates.title: Spam validation check now added to Auth templates#
How to use packages from private registries#
updates.description: Edge Functions now support importing NPM packages from private registries. You will need to deploy your functions using Supabase CLI version v1.207.9 or above to make use of this feature.

updates.title: Disk size usage section under organization settings#
updates.description: We've added a new disk size section for paid plans to give a quick overview of each project under the organization and their respective disk sizes for better visibility over the corresponding charges. This is only an initial iteration for this UI, we do plan to add historical statistics and more to improve visibility and transparency over what you're using and what you're paying for üôÇ

updates.title: Supabase + Vercel Partnership#
updates.description: We‚Äôve announced a Vercel partnership, we‚Äôre hosting an AI hackathon with our friends at Y Combinator, and we raised $80M. Let‚Äôs dive right in:

updates.title: Why?#
updates.description: We improved the information architecture (IA) on our docs site.

updates.title: Summary#
updates.description: Returning XHTML responses from the Data APIs and Edge Functions is now only allowed if a Custom Domain is being used.
